Below is my audit response as a senior UI/SEO/i18n auditor for your Next.js app. I've focused on precision, providing actionable checklists with exact Tailwind classes, code snippets, and metadata examples. Assumptions: Global dark theme is already set in `src/app/[locale]/layout.tsx` (e.g., ``). We're unifying across RU/EN locales for a premium, consistent look (no gradients, subtle dark-mode cards). I've cross-referenced common SEO/i18n issues from the audit report (e.g., missing per-page metas, inconsistent canonicals/hreflangs, no x-default, duplicates). --- ### UI Checklist with Tailwind Examples Apply this unified page shell to all pages under `src/app/[locale]/**` (e.g., partners, legal/dpa|offer|contract|pdp|sla, privacy, features, use-cases, pricing, fund, downloads, success). Update `src/app/[locale]/layout.tsx` for global elements (e.g., header/footer). Use a consistent spacing scale: multiples of 4px (e.g., p-4=16px, p-8=32px) for premium breathing room. Headings: Use sans-serif font (e.g., Inter via CSS import), with bold weights and subtle opacity for hierarchy. 1. **Global Container (in layout.tsx)**: Wrap page content in a max-width container for consistency. Add vertical spacing. - Snippet: ```tsx // src/app/[locale]/layout.tsx
{children}
``` 2. **Card Style**: Use for sections like features, pricing tiers, legal blocks. Premium dark-mode: semi-transparent white overlay with blur for depth. - Snippet: ```tsx // Example in src/app/[locale]/features/page.tsx
{/* Content here */}
``` 3. **Headings**: Consistent hierarchy. H1 for page titles (large, centered if hero), H2 for sections, H3 for subsections. Add subtle tracking for premium feel. - Snippet: ```tsx // Page title (H1)

Page Title

// Section heading (H2)

Section Heading

// Subsection (H3)

Subsection

``` 4. **Spacing Scale**: Apply vertically between elements (e.g., sections, cards). Use `space-y-*` for stacks. - Snippet: ```tsx // Vertical stack in a page (e.g., use-cases)
{/* From item 2 */}
// Horizontal padding inside containers
{/* Content */}
``` 5. **Consistency Audit Steps**: - Scan all pages: Ensure no legacy gradients (e.g., remove `bg-gradient-to-r` classes). - Locale-agnostic: Use CSS variables or Tailwind for text (e.g., `text-white` works for RU/EN). - Test: Render in dark mode, check for premium feel (subtle blur/shadows). Use browser dev tools to inspect classes. --- ### SEO/i18n Checklist Fix issues from the audit report: Missing per-page metas (use unique titles/descriptions), incorrect canonicals (e.g., not locale-specific), incomplete hreflangs (missing pairs/x-default), duplicates (e.g., same meta across pages). Implement in each page's `metadata` export using Next.js Metadata API. Assume domain is `https://example.com`, with paths like `/en/features` and `/ru/features`. Set x-default to English. Use i18n library (e.g., next-intl) for translations. 1. **Page-Specific Metas**: Define unique title, description, OG/Twitter for each page. Avoid generics; tailor to content (e.g., features page highlights benefits). - Example TS for Next.js Metadata (in page.tsx): ```ts // src/app/[locale]/features/page.tsx import { Metadata } from 'next'; export const metadata: Metadata = { title: { default: 'Features | YourApp', // Fallback template: '%s | YourApp', // For dynamic subpages }, description: 'Discover premium features of YourApp for seamless integration and performance.', openGraph: { title: 'Features | YourApp', description: 'Explore advanced features tailored for your needs.', url: 'https://example.com/[locale]/features', // Replace [locale] dynamically images: [{ url: '/og-features.jpg', width: 1200, height: 630 }], siteName: 'YourApp', locale: 'en_US', // Or 'ru_RU' based on locale param type: 'website', }, twitter: { card: 'summary_large_image', title: 'Features | YourApp', description: 'Premium features for YourApp users.', images: ['/twitter-features.jpg'], }, }; ``` - Repeat for each page (e.g., pricing: title='Pricing Plans | YourApp', description='Affordable tiers for all users.'). 2. **Canonical per Locale Path**: Set to absolute URL with locale (e.g., `/en/pricing` canonicalizes to `https://example.com/en/pricing`). - Add to metadata: ```ts // In metadata object alternates: { canonical: 'https://example.com/[locale]/page-path', // Dynamically insert locale and path }, ``` 3. **Hreflang Pairs and x-default**: Include en-US/ru-RU pairs + x-default (en-US). Avoid duplicates by ensuring unique per page. - Add to metadata (or Head component if dynamic): ```ts // In metadata object (Next.js handles rendering) alternates: { languages: { 'en-US': 'https://example.com/en/page-path', 'ru-RU': 'https://example.com/ru/page-path', 'x-default': 'https://example.com/en/page-path', // English as default }, }, ``` - For all pages: Ensure pairs cover both locales. No self-referencing duplicates. 4. **Avoid Duplicates and i18n Fixes**: - Use translated strings: Integrate next-intl for locale-specific metas (e.g., `title: t('features.title')`). - Checklist per page: [ ] Unique title/desc, [ ] Locale-specific canonical, [ ] Full hreflang set, [ ] No duplicate metas across pages (e.g., diff privacy vs. legal/dpa). - Global in layout.tsx: Set robots if needed (e.g., `robots: 'index, follow'`). --- ### Risk Notes and Quick Tests **Risks**: - UI: Inconsistent spacing/cards could lead to cluttered, non-premium feel (e.g., mobile breakage if no responsive px/py). Risk of locale-specific bugs if RU text overflows (longer words). - SEO/i18n: Missing x-default/hreflang pairs cause Google to ignore alternates, leading to duplicate content penalties or wrong locale indexing. Incorrect canonicals risk crawl errors. Duplicates dilute SEO (e.g., same desc on pricing/fund pages). - Overall: Poor mobile SEO scores if metas aren't optimized; accessibility issues if dark theme contrast fails (white text on #0B1220 is WCAG-compliant but test). **Quick Tests**: - **UI**: Run `npm run dev`, inspect elements in Chrome DevTools (Elements tab) for matching classes (e.g., search for `bg-white/5`). Test responsive: Resize to mobile/desktop, check spacing. - **SEO/i18n**: Use Lighthouse (Chrome DevTools > Lighthouse tab, run SEO/Mobile audits) â Check for "Document has a meta description" (score 100), "Hreflang tags are valid". Network tab: Load page, inspect response headers for canonical. HTML checks: View source, grep for `` and hreflang tags (e.g., ``). Validate with Google Search Console (URL Inspection) for indexing issues. - **Validation Script**: Add a CI test with Playwright: `await page.goto('/en/features'); await expect(page.locator('link[rel="canonical"]')).toHaveAttribute('href', 'https://example.com/en/features');`.
